Literature Review: Genetic biocontrol has emerged as a promising approach to manage wild populations, particularly in the context of pest control. The advent of CRISPR (Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats) gene editing technology has revolutionized the field, enabling precise and efficient modifications to genomes. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of CRISPR technologies for genetic biocontrol, highlighting the progress and ongoing challenges of using these approaches.
